465376e4-0af0-32c8-add3-daf9cfa3facd:
["Here’s an improved prompt that aims to clarify the definition of a traceability link and reduce ambiguity:

<START>
"Evaluate the following two artifacts from the same software system to determine if a traceability link exists. A traceability link is defined as a direct reference or a clear dependency where one artifact explicitly relies on, supports, or is derived from the other in terms of functionality, requirements, or implementation. 

Artifact 1: [Insert Artifact 1 Text Here]
Artifact 2: [Insert Artifact 2 Text Here]

Please respond with 'yes' if there is a clear traceability link, or 'no' if there is not. If you choose 'no', please briefly explain why you believe there is no link."
<END>

This prompt aims to provide a more precise definition of a traceability link and encourages the classifier to consider the nature of the relationship more critically. Additionally, asking for a brief explanation when responding 'no' can help clarify the reasoning behind the decision, which may improve the overall accuracy of the classifier."]
